website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch microwave that guarantees ultra-efficient cooking at all temperature levels.
pros: Equipped with Inverter Technology that delivers a constant stream of cooking power
Compact design makes the microwave a great choice in kitchens of all sizes
Boasts auto-adjustment capabilities for fast, evenly cooked meals every time
Turbo Defrost ensures you won't have to wait long to thaw frozen foods
cons: Error codes sometimes can be tough to resolve

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase ever from Panasonic and Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Since I purchased this microwave in August 2017 I have to have it serviced three times and the problem is still not fixed. Panasonic has me send it to the same repair technicians who send it back with a different excuse each time. It works a couple of times then the power goes dead. From the time of purchase I have been able to use it probably ten times. Worst purchase ever from Panasonic and Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Danny L. Cash

customer_reviews.title: It had a nice set of features & the use of a knob ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another microwave that died after a long life. It had a nice set of features & the use of a knob to set times seemed interesting. Worked great for 4 days - then the time setting knob died. Without it, the microwave is mostly useless. I then discovered that there seems to be no way to contact Panasonic support via phone - and the online chat only is available 8-5 EST. This is quite unacceptable these days. Returning it & purchased a different brand as a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Richard S Chernock

customer_reviews.title: What happened to appliances that lasted more than a year and a half?
customer_reviews.text: Was a very nice unit right up until it died, just short of a year and a half after I started using it. What a load of crap. There is absolutely no reason why a microwave should not last 10 years or better; planned obsolescence is not going to work for Panasonic, as I will not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: zgmcgee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent built-in replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased with a trim kit for built-in application. Unit is relatively quiet and powerful. Controls are well thought-out allowing simple, frequent tasks to be done easily and quickly. Door opens and closes more easily than the unit replaced. Delivery was as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: This item total failed in less than 2 months we asked for it to be replaced by Panasonic and they refused, it's been weeks without the oven and there is no estimate on how long it will take to repair. Don,t buy this junk, lousy oven lousy warranty service. It should be a no questions asked here is a new oven when it fails in two months. Very disappointing. Total junk
customer_reviews.author: R Ballard

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The main button that you use to pop open the door sticks constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous piece of equipment. Within 3 months the center ...
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous piece of equipment. Within 3 months the center cog on which you put the rotating tray melted. Now this week, the microwave caught fire. Move on to something else. Suggest you not buy Panasonic. Also their customer support is non existent.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Surles

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Quiality!
customer_reviews.text: purchased less than 1 year ago. It died this AM. after the "burial", thought I'd add my 2 cents. It wasn't a bad unit, but we should have been able to get more than 351 days use from it. Amazing how quality sucks on so many products, they cut quality to keep pricing down, so we need to replace them sooner. Planned obsolesence! sell more product, CEO's get bigger bonuses!. Some day, again, maybe we'll see things made with "American" quality and pride, but not currently. oh well.......
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Great, but unreliable
customer_reviews.text: We had this microwave for five months when it stopped working. The error message indicated the microwave power unit failed. To get it repaired, we have to take it to a repair center which is a four hour drive away. Panasonic will pay only a small portion of the return shipping. The seller only offers a 30 day warranty. While working, the microwave was great.
customer_reviews.author: LAR46

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only about a year
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this one. Bought it in Oct 2016 and after 1 year and 4 months of average use; it totally died. Wouldn't power on. Is it too much to expect microwaves costing $200+ to last a lot longer than that. The microwave worked reasonably well during that time (door button was an issue), Panasonic customer support was most unhelpful.
customer_reviews.author: Ankrishn

customer_reviews.title: The Dodge Hellcat of microwaves
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for way more horsepower in your next microwave then this is your buy. Love the Knob instead of a keypad and the 20 preset sensor cook settings are convenient. Coffee and milk warm button which is great and this thing cooks quickly. I can also finally defrost meat without it turning into rubber. Spend the extra coin and grab this thing while its hot.
customer_reviews.author: crash2311

customer_reviews.title: DIED AFTER 4 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: Started sparking. Code says power supply went bad. My last GE model lasted 20+ years. Was just OK while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: waljoy

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 5 months. Now, when I ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 5 months. Now, when I enter a duration and press Start, the magnetron no longer kicks on and after counting down one number the displayed number resets to zero. We are heavily dependent on our microwave to prepare oatmeal fore breakfast before rushing the kids to school. Now I have to go through the hassle of getting a new microwave and dealing with warrantee issues. How hard is it to make a microwave that just works? :(.
customer_reviews.author: Mario C

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Panasonic with issue
customer_reviews.text: Product was not working out of the box. Bought another one with poor reliability. Was my last Panasonic. Missing the old time when this was a premium brand
customer_reviews.author: Patsss

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave plenty of power stylish good color great fit ...
customer_reviews.text: i've had this unit for (7) months and now the microwave will not respond to any COMMANDS to OPERATE i cant get in touch with any one for service repair or replacement DON'T BUY THIS MICROWAVE UNIT.
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: Weak Door Hinges
customer_reviews.text: I have used this appliance for 1.5 years. At the one year mark, the door latch began sticking in the open position. I resolved the problem by spraying cooking oil into latch button recess. Presently, I notice the door is sagging due to its loose at the pivot point of the door. The cooking performance is great. The electronics has never shown a flaw. Becuase of the weak hinge, I don't expect this model is last 15+ years as my previous microwave did. But I paid >$350 for my previous appliance. A loose door hinge is somewhat disquieting to the operator of a microwave, so I give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: 1988scotsdale

customer_reviews.title: Great cooking, Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I have used this microwave for about two months, replacing a previous Panasonic. I'll start by saying it works just fine. My objections are to its design, compared to the previous model.. Panasonic has removed some of my most-used buttons, such as the sensor reheat, and put the function on a very fiddly dial, hard to set for older eyes. Also, the oven light is so weak it is almost useless. Too bad when a beautifully designed product gets degraded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad doors
customer_reviews.text: Only 2 months old the door will only open when it wants to do you a favor. (One month warranty) Very disappointed in Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: T. Middlebrooks

customer_reviews.title: The microwave fits great in the cabinet and on the trim kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an in-cabinet Bosch overpriced microwave that died. Other reviewers stated this Panasonic microwave had the same dimensions and would fit perfectly to replace an old Bosch. The reviews were all correct. The microwave fits great in the cabinet and on the trim kit. Even the vent kit that I took off the old Bosch is designed perfectly for this Panasonic microwave. Thanks to all the reviewers that recommended this switch. Plus, the Panasonic microwave has an intuitive control panel. While about 1/2 the price, this microwave is a real upgrade from the Bosch!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Rufner

customer_reviews.title: I would give this microwave oven a zero if could ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give this microwave oven a zero if could. The start button has broken on 3 of them withing a year now. I have already returned two back to the seller and have to return this one now. At least I purchased the warranty protection this time. the start switch is ridiculously fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Cudoos Reheat and Cook
customer_reviews.text: So far working great! I especially like the Sensor Reheat and Sensor Cook. We upgraded in size from or last Panasonic micro wave, which lasted 15 years, and the larger size is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Cooks food evenly
customer_reviews.text: I really like this microwave so far. This is the best microwave I've used as far as heating food evenly. I usually use a reduced power setting with microwaves because the food is usually better this way. The inverter types of microwaves like this allow for true and even reduction of power. On the other hand at full power it heats quickly. So far, it has passed all the tests on the normal staples I might consume - hot pockets, eggs, reheating left overs, etc. I like the rotary knob used to set the cook time compared to pushing all the digits.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H

customer_reviews.title: Have a NN-SD945S,, used it a few times ...
customer_reviews.text: Have a NN-SD945S ,, used it a few times and the display started getting dim...now you can barely see it in the dark....anybody have the same problem?, part number?
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Harris

customer_reviews.title: Interior paint flaked off
customer_reviews.text: When closing the microwave door, it is loud. Maybe it is because it is a countertop model rather than a built in. To heat for 1 minute, 2 minutes, etc, you must punch in the numbers 1-0-0 rather than having a quick-set button. When buttons are pressed , they too are loud, but that's probably normal. I've had the microwave for 4 months and the interior paint has already started to come off. On the positive side, the microwave is BIG and Panasonic is offering a refund for the unit due to the paint issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: This product went out in 2 months with a reading area of H98. Its "Magnetron Circuit" Failed (which basically cooks the food). It seems to be a common problem with Panasonic. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn  R Brumley

customer_reviews.title: Defective door system, will not open when button is pushed
customer_reviews.text: The door will open when button is pressed. I have had Panasonic microwaves ever since they started making them. I liked them, until now. The door lock is defective. I have to use 2 hands to open door, one to jiggle door and other to push button. This is unacceptable and I will no longer be buying Panasonic microwaves.
customer_reviews.author: E F

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a microwave on October 3, 2019 and it stopped working on December 20, 2019 with an error message H97. I called Panasonic and they said for me to look for a dealer in my area which is 50 miles away. I have had no brand microwaves and they lasted for years. I decided to get a name brand Panasonic and it stopped working under 3-months. Wow, I will never buy a Panasonic again. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brookshyre

customer_reviews.title: For Six Months, I Loved It, But...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this microwave for six months. I loved it. It's a powerhouse. It was great...until it wasn't. Yeah, six months, and this thing crapped out during a two minute setting. Let's see what the warranty is like.
customer_reviews.author: Girlina

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 yrs +3 months
customer_reviews.text: the microwave is not really anything special other than it is large and for our family of 13 that has been a very important feature. for the most part for two years it has worked. The dial feature is annoying and not really and value add. The sad part is that it DIED after just 2 years and 3 months of service. So I would NOT recommend buying this. The Panasonic warranty is only 1 year on parts and labor. That is also terrible! So it's fine if you don't mind spending $200+ on microwave oven every two years. Not me, I am looking for another brand altogether!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Barreras

customer_reviews.title: It heats food, loudly, and for much money.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. Door is stage and not quite right. Tray inside rattles as it rotates. Annoying. Noisy.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: A very good choice
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a very old one and are very happy with the new Panasonic microwave. It takes awhile to learn all the controls and settings but once that's done, it's pretty easy to use. The one thin we dislike is the long list of settings you have to use with sensor cook. The list appears only in the owners' manual so you have the have that thing kicking around. There's no guessing what to use for a given food. The list would be better attached somehow or even in a small drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Steere

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping for a better product.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this product less than a month and the button to open the door doesn’t work. Now I have to take it to a repair shop to have it fixed. Yes it under a one year warranty, but it is inconvenient for me due to back issues to try to find someone to hall it to and from a repair shop
customer_reviews.author: CBS

customer_reviews.title: Just so you know - When the Lightbulb Burns Out You Must Disassemble the Microwave to Replace it!
customer_reviews.text: Just so you know - When the Light Bulb Burns Out You Must Disassemble the Microwave to Replace it! I've had this microwave for almost 2 years and it is ok for a microwave, nothing special. After about 18 months the lightbulb burned out. The user's manual does not discuss a lightbulb, let alone how to replace it. Looking on U-tube I saw a guy remove the case and go into the guts of the machine to replace the bulb. The lightbulb didn't look at all standard. They just don't build appliances the way they use to.
customer_reviews.author: R. T. Appleby

customer_reviews.title: Superb microwave for large dishes and family daily use
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic is my go-to brand in microwaves. Its friendly design, humongous interior, and the great wattage make it the ideal home cooking and reheating companion. This model is particularly spacious for a countertop microwave, so make sure you note the dimensions as it can dwarf every other countertop applicance in your kitchen. The interior now has LED lighting that's really bright. Easy to use menu and buttons (with sensory feedback - i.e. feel the click).
customer_reviews.author: Robin Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Good Microwave BUT....
customer_reviews.text: This microwave does a very good job at what it is supposed to do. It is easy to operate and looks great. The interior is easy to clean. However, this microwave WILL INTERFERE WITH YOUR WIFI! I have several smart home products in my kitchen (Smart display, switches, echo dot) and they all go offline when operating this oven. They do load back up within seconds of the microwave turning off, but this is a real issue for me. If you have any smart devices in your kitchen, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: VERY short life span!!  Don’t purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This microwave has stopped working, code N97, and I’ve not had it for quite 1 1/2 years. I’ve actually never had a microwave die on me, using them for decades. I moved to the west coast, getting rid of a lot of my household goods before the relocation, and wanted to get a microwave. Seems awful to have such a short life! I would NOT recommend this product. Update: I paid to have it repaired a year ago. It cost me a little over $100. Great repair place in SE Portland. It’s stopped working... again. This microwave is garbage. I’ve never had one that died. Period. Except this one! Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: cleedenver

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Microwave!
customer_reviews.text: A few weeks ago I decided to replace the Panasonic Microwave that I got in the 1980's. It still works but the power isn't as strong as the new Microwaves, so it was time. Because it was a Panasonic that supplied Several Decades(!) of dependable use I looked to Panasonic again. This Panasonic NN-SN966S Microwave is a wonderful appliance and it has such a small footprint and it's sooo powerful and has lots of room on the inside. It's a great Microwave and I hope it lasts as long as the Panasonic that it's replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Kent J. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Working flawlessly so far.
customer_reviews.text: Unit it replaces only performed at peak for 3 years. Special features seem to work very well. This is an updated version of the one it replaces. Large size of turntable, in fact it's exact dimensions, was a deciding factor as we have microwave cookware requiring these dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for several days. It replaced a 25 year old Sanyo that kept my coffee hot until it's last gasp. It's a great looking machine - very slick and modern. It runs quietly - it seems like mostly the fan sound. The turntable moves smoothly and, again, very quietly. It cooks more evenly than my old machine. I love those microwave pot pies that brown all over. They come out perfectly :) The price here on Amazon is about 3% lower than most other outlets. Along with Prime Shipping, I feel like this is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: FFB Photo

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic and Amazon support STINK
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste you money on anything Panasonic. I cannot get a live person or even chat support. We have had this microwave only 1 year and the damn key pad stopped working. There is power to the unit but the buttons stopped working. I can’t even get any support from Amazon. Prime is going to hell more and more. Bezo’s seems to only give a crap about his checkbook
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Trim kit listed is not a fit, and this cannot be built into cabinet by oven
customer_reviews.text: Actually beautiful large microwave, however I gave it a low rating because the trim kit listed is too large for this model, and also if you plan to build into a cabinet, one needs to be aware that a label on the back of the microwave stated it cannot be installed within 2 ft. of a regular oven.
customer_reviews.author: myreel

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be ok but I'm a panasonic fan
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Panasonic microwave. I have had good luck with all of them. My only qualm with this one is that the labeling of the controls is not so good. its gray rather than bright white and takes a lot more effort to see. I looked in the instructions to see if there was an instruction to brighten them up but no. I wish they had a decal to send me....
customer_reviews.author: JHS Miami

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, Panasonic quality
customer_reviews.text: We've had this microwave for a couple of months now. I have only used it a couple of times but my wife loves it. I do like the quick 30sec button! I bought it to replace our old microwave that was over 20 years old. I sure hope this one is build that well. I have found over the years that you just can't go too wrong with Panasonic. I did not buy the trim kit because I read others complain about it. Instead, I mounted the unit in our cabinet and used wood molding to trim it in for a custom, built-in appearance.
customer_reviews.author: southernstranger

customer_reviews.title: 1 year today
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this microwave for 1 year today. We like the even cooking from this unit. So far it has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: WV & SD together

customer_reviews.title: Works so far
customer_reviews.text: I spent quite a bit of time researching microwaves and really wanted one without the turntable. It turns out they are only sold outside the USA. I've had good luck with Panasonic in the past but was a little concerned about the reliability having faded over the years. I rarely, if ever, buy an extended warranty, but did in this case. The unit works fine so far, but I will be back to report any problems. Hope I don't have to deal with Panasonic customer service as they apparently aren't the best.
customer_reviews.author: pmthomas

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This microwave so far is awesome! We put it in the built in spot where our old one was & despite the fact that they both fit, this one has so much more room inside because it goes much deeper- like it’s huge inside! It also has a dial setting where u just turn the dial and digitally it shows u how many seconds ( or minutes) instead of having to punch in the numbers. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Good Microwave - Hope it Lasts Given the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great microwave. Accurate setttings. I would have given it 5 stars if it had 1 touch buttons like my old microwave - touch the number 1 and it cooks for 1 minute, the number 2 and it cooks for 2 minutes etc. Gawd, how lazy am I? Now I have to press 1 and then press start. Well, I'm in a hurry that's why I'm using a microwave in the first place. Has lots of settings I probably won't use. But, my husband does a lot of the cooking and he tried the defrost function on a pound of ground beef and like other reviewers reports that it thawed without cooking the edges of the meat. Hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: MargieFromKC

customer_reviews.title: Great Microwave While it Lasted
customer_reviews.text: This microwave worked well for its short lifespan. Unfortunately, It has only been with us just over a year and a half before suffering some fatal malady and now displays H98 instead of the time-of-day in its little green window. It apparently has had a stroke and the nearest service center is 200 miles away according to Panasonic’s non-supporting customer support center. This is my first and will be my last experience with a Panasonic appliance. Just purchased a GE microwave as a replacement. My last microwave was a GE, and was still going strong after 10 years when sold with our last house. And an added bonus, should it malfunction I have local repair support.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Voorhees

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave - I owned the prev version and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: SO far so good. I owned the earlier model that lasted about 8 years, I wish this had a 1 minute button like the prev version, it does not - has a 30 sec button instead. The door latch is easier to engage, the inside light is toward the front rather than the back. GOOD QUALITY, good looking, good price. - Nice and BIG.
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Died 33 days after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Delivered July 28 and died today, Aug 31 (4 days after return window) It's was a nice microwave, but now what do I do? I communicated with online service support from Panasonic, but they said I need to call a repair person because they can't find one. Near Jacksonville FL.!!! Update Oct 6 still no help or replacement. I have contacted Panasonic 4 times and they keep saying they will be in touch with a solution. They explained there is no repairperson in 200 miles so I might need to mail it.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had a countertop microwave in over 20 years. Moved to the ‘ sticks ‘ in Texas and the kitchen didn’t have a built in. This is a large countertop item and can fit large items... large plates, two small plates big Tupperware. It’s awesome!! Heats food extremely fast. We like that we can turn off the “beeping “ feature when the food is done. Totally easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: JAE

customer_reviews.title: SECOND DAMAGED GOODS RECEIVED
customer_reviews.text: I can't review the item as it arrive obviosly having been dropped. The metal plate that covers the door opening mechanism was bent and just thrown in the box. The microwave itself had a 8" dent in the upper right hand side, there was none of the usual paperwork. It was obviously a prior return that got passed on to me as if I'd be a sucker to accept it. This also happened with a computer I purchased about a year ago. Why does Amazon keep recycling damaged goods, (mostly larger objects) ?? I purchased them on Amazon because what I wanted was not available in any local store.
customer_reviews.author: GBSjax

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, silent microwave
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with the fact that I can turn all of the beeps off so the microwave is completely silent. The only thing that's annoying is there's a separate add 30 second button from the start button unlike most microwaves where you can just hit start and it'll start on 30 seconds and you can re-hit it to add time.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Piece of nice looking junk!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking product, that does not last!! Did not make 2 years of service. Tried to contact the manufacturer, lost cause!! You get lost in phone support hell. Finally get a phone number of a service center that is 40 minutes from home, not in business anymore!! Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: M A C

customer_reviews.title: Top Brand
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the finest microwave we’ve ever owned. Inverter Technology really makes cooking and warming leftovers superior to the cheap microwaves. This proves that you get what you pay for; buy cheap, you get junk. This unit is real quality. Now I see why Consumer Reports rated Panasonic top brand.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like the older model inverter
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older same size Panasonic Inverter with this one. I wasn't sure about the "Cyclonic" feature, but went with it figuring it would be better. Instead, what used to take a minute for coffee water now takes two minutes and re-warming food takes longer than before. I'm not seeing any advantage from the "Cylonic" part of this microwave. I have to wonder had I ordered the standard inverter if it would be performing the same as my older one.
customer_reviews.author: BLB

customer_reviews.title: Learning Curve, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This microwave/induction oven heats/cooks food quickly. It looks very smart, but a person has to be pretty smart to use it, I think. The instruction booklet is totally mystifying to me. I just guess based on what my old microwave did, and then deduct a minute from the cook time. Example: A tv dinner that used to be done in 5 minutes, will come out looking like an old shoe at five minutes. At 4 minutes--perfection. (your experiences may vary).
customer_reviews.author: Old Warrior Woman

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a little over a year.
customer_reviews.text: This big hunk of junk broke in less than a year. I loved it while it worked. Panasonic has terrible customer service. I got an error code H97 and would no longer work. This microwave was too expensive to have to be replaced so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz83

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far and no issue with door
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far and no issue with door. Only drawback is having to push button multiple times to change the power. It starts at power level 10 which is what we mostly use. But to get to power level 5 you must press the power level button 4 times. So to get to poser lever 1 you must press the power lever 9 times. This is a little cumbersome but how many of us use power lever one anyway. The interior is actually bigger than my 30 year old microwave/convection oven (imagine anything lasting that long today) so you could cook a 10-12 pound turkey in it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Microwave with great interior room
customer_reviews.text: We could not be more pleased with Panasonic's design & overall reliability of this product. For the digits, we would prefer a newer, blue-hue display lighting to complement our other appliances vs the older, soft amber display lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a couple of months now and are pleasantly surprised how well some of the features work. The popcorn settings are too long or too short, unfortunately, but that's really where the cons end. I was pleasantly surprised by the defrost mode and sensor reheat. Both do the job perfectly! As long as your estimation of the weight of meat is close and you remember to flip it when it beeps, it wool defrost perfectly without cooking the corners. As long as your food is spread out on the plate, it heats it to the perfect temperature (slightly hotter than you'd want to eat it, giving time for everyone to get to the table). Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: This Panasonic stopped working after one use!! We ...
customer_reviews.text: This Panasonic stopped working after one use!! We trusted Panasonic from prior successes with their products so tossed the packaging right away. Now we have the big hassle of having to return it and to find a box to fit. Save yourself the trouble and don't buy this faulty item.
customer_reviews.author: gifted

customer_reviews.title: Very large, need dedicated space
customer_reviews.text: I found this microwave a bit more challenging to use. It is huge inside and takes up a good part of my counter but I have the space. I liked it when it worked but this microwave just stopped working on and off about a month ago. It is now dead and the closest authorized repair place is 114 miles from my home. We checked the outlets and moved it and another appliance and the other appliance works but this microwave has just died. I chatted with a Panasonic rep earlier today and I sent them my receipt and now I wait to find out what to do. I'm not happy with this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Ann Augulis

customer_reviews.title: Contents burst into flames after one month of use
customer_reviews.text: We received the microwave oven on May 5. On June 26, during routine use, the contents of the microwave burst into flames. The heat shattered the microwave-safe glass bowl that we have always used to microwave things. Amazon would not process a return or refund, since it was outside of the 30-day refund period. So far, Panasonic has not been helpful, either. We called them during their posted support hours, but the message said that they were closed. I will update this review if/when Panasonic replaces the unit or refunds our purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Spinner's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Very nice upgrade to the standard-type microwave we had before this that died of old age.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice upgrade to the standard-type microwave we had before this that died of old age. I love that 50% power means half the wattage instead of cycling it on and off. It means the food heats slower instead of burning slower which helps a ton on reheats, defrosting, and frozen food cooking. I haven't had it a year or quite 6 months, but I very much like it so far and use the lower power settings regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: We love this microwave.
customer_reviews.text: We have had 3 of this model microwave. All have worked exceptionally well and would still have them but for circumstances that we had to give them away.. For various reasons we don't have the original 2, but they had been working fine after many years of use. I specifically sought out this machine because it is easy to use and we've never had any problems with our others. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Broke 3x and left with lost money. Worst microwave ever.
customer_reviews.text: The microwave stopped working a month or two after we got it. So we sent it back and they sent us another one. It broke again so we sent it back and got another one. It broke. Again. The worst microwave and warranty experience I’ve ever witnessed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Bought a prime “ very good” item which was only supposed to have “slight cosmetic” issues. Thought the Start button didn’t work-turned out the door wasn’t shutting correctly. Thought it was ok until my son looked inside and there was peeling and an area that looked like an opening from the “ cosmetic “ issue in the back. Returning and bought a new version.
customer_reviews.author: Gina S

customer_reviews.title: May burn your popcorn
customer_reviews.text: I like it but it is a little bigger than I expected. I bought this one because it was only $40 more than the smaller version. I use it for popcorn quite often and it will burn the popcorn if you set it for the proper size bag. If you set it for the next smaller choice the popcorn turns out great. This is much more powerful than my previous microwave. The auto-thaw feature works great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: It takes awhile to program. All I had to do with my former microwave is plug it in and set the clock, but then, hey...it didn't have all the bells and whistles this one does. The one thing I don't like (or maybe I just haven't figured this out yet) is that after the timer goes off, it doesn't have reminder sounds, so if I don't hear it the first time or I forget, whatever is in the microwave stays there. I miss being reminded! I have not used all its features yet so cannot review on those.
customer_reviews.author: worship2AbbaFather

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working before just before 1 year. They wanted us to drive it 30 miles to have them look at it and decide if it was our fault. Will never buy a Panansonic again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like good oven at a very good price when bought as "like new".
customer_reviews.text: This review is based on under one month of ownership. Bought it as an Amazon "used, like new, damaged original packaging". Box had minor damage. Oven looked new/unused. Works great, especially reheat function. Fast. Looks good. Raised buttons feel good in use. Door open large button feels like quality and I hope it lasts as some have said the door release is the Achilles heal of modern Panasonic ovens.
customer_reviews.author: Occupying Force

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic not what they use to be.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a week just fine then just started tripping breakers as soon as you hit the start button. Move to a new outlet try again same thing. So sending this one back and trying a different one hopefully all goes well. If you buy it I'll wish you the best of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Baker

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working Two Weeks Over 1 Year Warranty
customer_reviews.text: We owned the previous model for 10+ years. Purchased the model as a replacement and the microwave stopped working out of nowhere exactly 14 days after the 1 year warranty. No notice, no issues, just went to heat up a cup of coffee and the microwave stopped working. Would definitely NOT purchase again. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous1*

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: This works like a charm! I read tons of product reviews before choosing this model to replace one that we’d had for 15 years. We loved our old one, a GE model that cost around $250, and picked this model due to the size and reviews. We picked the model with the turnknob. So easy to use!! Fast! Easy to program. quiet. Very nice looking and easy to clean.👍👍👍👍👍 everyone in my family loves it.great job!
customer_reviews.author: A. Galer

customer_reviews.title: Died after two years
customer_reviews.text: The microwave just died today. I only purchased it two years ago. I looked up the warranty just now and the manufacturer only covers defective parts for one year (the inverter went up on mine). I would not recommend buying this microwave. I should have listened to the other reviewers who had similar problems.
customer_reviews.author: coolasbluefire

customer_reviews.title: Good learning functions override downsides
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to hear the timer alert as others have mentioned. The silver box shows every fingerprint. I miss my soften and melt feature of my old oven. I do like the sense reheat and defrost functions, they work really well. . That’s what made me keep it despite the downsides, Plenty big for holiday heating
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: defect in manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: button for to open door does not work. great microwave if this button worked
customer_reviews.author: Ella and Casey

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Amazing bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: So impressed! Hated my 3 yr old GE profile..so glad when it died. This panosonic has top rating with consumer reports for it's size and I'm thrilled ! Two days in and I ha ENT been this happy with a microwave since sharp introduced convection combos (miss those)! Fab price!
customer_reviews.author: Kate, in Louisville, KY

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic NN-SN996S microwave
customer_reviews.text: Excellent microwave. Looks good with the other stainless appliances in my kitchen. My last Panasonic microwave lasted 20 year. My current $500 GE top of the line Profile model could not cook a large batches of bacon without smoking three Magitrons before I put in the trash. It was a very good looking piece of junk. I went back to what works for me. It has a huge interior cooking area and is close to the same size foot print on the kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: George M

customer_reviews.title: Light weight & bright interior
customer_reviews.text: I both like & dislike the lightness of the oven. While easy to move, It also moves when you press hard on the door button. I noticed on previous reviews, before I bought it, that people complained about the door button being hard to open. When I got it, I didn't seem to have that problem, but I have had the door not open right away a few times since. When I pushed harder, the oven moved back. I need to use all the features to get use to them so I can't really say too much about them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, Powerful & Versatile!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect - Great looking with plenty of cooking room. I love the many versatile features including the turntable. Fits nicely on my kitchen counter but would do nicely built in to the appropriate space. One caution - this is a powerful unit so you'll need to adapt if you're used to cooking with a lower wattage microwave. It took some time & experimentation but it's well worth the slight learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: Don Anastas

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: After using for only a year and a half the microwave has quit working. It runs for 2 only seconds and then shuts off. It is now worthless. It costs nearly as much to get repaired as it did to buy it. I thought Panasonic was a trustworthy product. I learned my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Dial? No numbers!
customer_reviews.text: Don't like the dial! I'm old fashioned and like the old way of punching in the exact number of seconds/minutes. This microwave does not allow precise time! It allows 10 second increments. I failed to realize how it operates. I assumed too much. It is also noisey! It "rattles" when it is on. This is the most expensive and worse microwave I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: SuziQzie

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this microwave!  Cheap Chinese junk!
customer_reviews.text: Microwave does not reliably heat a simple cup of coffee. The door sounds tinny and does not close properly. It looks and sounds cheap. There is only a small useless button size light inside the microwave so you cannot truly see what you cooked without using a flashlight. The clock would not work as it constantly loses time. The numbers on the exterior are dull and you can barely see what they are to set the time or the item you want to cook. It is just poor value and cheap construction. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent microwave
customer_reviews.text: Love this microwave! The inverter technology is amazing, defrosts food perfectly even and super fast. I'm actually happy that my old microwave blew up so I could get this one. The size is perfect, very large inside but sleek outside. Shipping was very fast from this seller too. I got it about a week sooner than expected. Very happy!!
customer_reviews.author: JuliaP

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This microwave lasted exactly 13 months and 3 days. It no longer turns on at all. When I tried to call for technical help, Panasonic will not assist without first paying a $99.00 fee since the item is over 12 months old. The microwave worked just fine during the first 12 months while it was under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Gartner

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Room, Works Great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have only used the microwave for a month or so but like it very much. Large capacity worked well preparing Thanksgiving. The defrost feature works extremely well (doesn't cook the food on the edges!) and the reheat sensor works well on most things. One feature we don't like is the knob to set the timer. It takes some getting used to since we're so used to just entering the numbers on a key pad. Overall we're really pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charcoal lover

customer_reviews.title: HUGE Microwave.
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize just how bid the inside was! It works very well and no issues so far. Will fit on a 15-inch deep sideboard. I am very pleased with this unit and highly recommend it! Someone had mentioned that they had issues with cleaning the inside because of the flap being paper???? It is metal and I can wipe it down with ease. Sensor reheating is WONDERFUL! The sensor defrost works perfectly! I am still exploring all the cooking possibilities but have not been frustrated or disappointed at all so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dee A

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: At this point the only problem is the popcorn setting. My last microwave I could just select the popcorn button and have perfect popcorn no matter the size because it monitored it. With this microwave it has three choices by ounces. Problem is I have found no popcorn that matches any of the ounces settings. So the popcorn button is useless. Even though I have prime shipping that I pay extra for it came 2 days late. The United States Post office lied about why it was late.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Sonrise

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This model was the top rated microwave in Consumer Reports when I was shopping. I have been very pleased with the item. The exact model number was hard to find. There are new generations of this more widely available now.
customer_reviews.author: John_A

customer_reviews.title: Great microwave
customer_reviews.text: Have owned many microwaves over the decades - cheap and expensive, counter, under counter and built in. This one with the additional trim kit makes for a beautiful built-in in my new kitchen. The microwave is roomy, quiet, easy to use, powerful and fast. I have nothing bad to say about it. I especially like the buttons which have a little "squish" to them when pushed. Have only had it a few weeks so can't speak to long term reliability but have had this brand previously with good results.
customer_reviews.author: DocO

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted a few months. Button to open door doesn’t work properly, error messages on screen require unplugging to clear, heats on highest level regardless of selection. And the light is already burned out. Complete junk
customer_reviews.author: johnebones

customer_reviews.title: Great cooking/heating microwave.
customer_reviews.text: If I had to do it over, I would spend the extra $45 to get the same oven, but without the "twist-knob" control panel, e.g., prefer the older style with keypad controls.
customer_reviews.author: Paladin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. But it is BIG!!! I had purchased a bakers cart to put it on, but it is so big that it wouldn't fit. Now it is our coffee Keurig station lol It also does cook quicker too, but our old one was real old. Newer tech.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on the trim kit.
customer_reviews.text: If you get this unit just put it on the countertop and not on a shelf with trim kit ....... half inch gaps between unit and the kit. Would not have purchased either if I had known.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It just about cooks for you!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new microwave! It just about cooks for you! The thaw feature works like magic. I live in an old building and was afraid it would blow the circuits but I haven’t had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: artnick

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 months WARRANTY SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: Died after 6 months, inverter went bad! 🤬Panasonic after extensively calling picked up and sent to be serviced, got it back a week later, door broken, filthy, and a completely dented on sides. Called customer service and now I have to send serial # label to them and there refunding my purchase price! I want a MICROWAVE! 3rd and last Panasonic! Going back to GE or Sharp. Don't BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Louise Steele

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This microwave lives up to previous reviews. It performs well and is reasonably easy to clean. I am not a fan of using a dial to indicate time as it requires more time to set the desired time. There is a 39 second button that I use much more frequently for times up to two minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Vera W

customer_reviews.title: Wow, just wow
customer_reviews.text: This is a crisp, clean, slick machine! Absolutely stunning visually and out performs every Microwave i've had. Option heavy, easily used, and simple to clean. Best of everything right here in this little guy. Buy :)
customer_reviews.author: Sean O'Dea

product_meta.title: Panasonic Countertop / Built-In Microwave Oven with Cyclonic Wave Inverter Technology and 1250W of Cooking Power - NN-SD975S - 2.2 Cu. Ft (Stainless Steel / Silver)
product_meta.description: Design:Cyclonic Inverter| Style Name:DialWhen it comes to everything you expect in a microwave, nothing compares with the defrosting, cooking and reheating capability of the Panasonic NN-SD975S microwave oven with cyclonic wave and Inverter technology. At every temperature level, cyclonic wave circulates heat in precise ultra-efficient 3d waves for easier more versatile food preparation, even with more complex food textures. This exceptional 1250-watt, 2. 2-Cubic-foot Capacity Stainless steel microwave with 16. 5-Inch turntable includes patented Inverter technology which, unlike traditional microwaves that rely on pulse-on, pulse-off power at lower temperatures, delivers a constant stream of cooking power at every temperature for more evenly cooked meals - edges to centers - Every time. Together, cyclonic wave and Inverter technology create and circulate microwave energy in a way that allows delicate foods like vegetables and fish to simmer without overcooking. Foods retain more Color, texture and nutrients for fast, easy and delicious results. One-touch genius sensor cook and reheat functions, takes the guesswork out of microwaving by automatically setting power levels and adjusting cooking or reheating time. This countertop microwave oven measures 23 7⁄8” W x 14” H x 19 15⁄16” D and has a Stainless steel door with silver wrap. As a countertop microwave, the Panasonic NN-SD975S can rest on any open surface in the kitchen and can be easily moved. For a finished built-in look, order trim kit For 27” cabinet (Panasonic part # nn-tk922ss) or Trim kit For 30” cabinet (Panasonic part # nn-tk932ss) and install directly into pre-existing cabinetry space. Disclaimer: Upper-inside left corner of microwave oven door has a small indentation to allow door to open smoothly. Do not store flammable materials next to, on top of, or in the microwave oven. Refer instruction manual for troubleshooting steps.
feature_bullets: Cyclonic wave microwave at every temperature level, cyclonic wave circulates heat in precise ultra efficient 3d waves for easier more versatile food preparation, even with more complex food textures
Microwave controls: 20 preset sensor cook menu items, inverter turbo defrost, delay start and timer, more/less control, child safety lock, quick 30 sec and popcorn button with 3 cooking levels
Minimum countertop footprint smart, compact design devotes less space to electronics and far more interior capacity; up to eight pounds lighter than conventional microwave ovens
Sensor invertor turbo defrost: Utilizes a microwave sequencing system based on inverter's continuous power delivery method to thaw foods more evenly and quickly
Keep warm feature microwave keeps foods like vegetables, soups, hors d'oeuvres, gravies, sauces and desserts warm and delicious in the oven until they're ready to serve

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,356 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
